abstract: This viewgraph presentation provides an overview of NASA-FAA (Federal Aviation Administration) and NOAA (National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration) collaboration efforts particularly in the area of aviation and aircraft safety. Five technology areas are being jointly by these agencies: (1) aviation weather information; (2) weather products; (3) automet technologies; (4) forward looking weather sensors and (5) turbulence controls and mitigation systems. Memorandum of Agreements (MOU) between these agencies are reviewed. A general review of the pros and pitfalls of inter-agency collaborations is also presented.
title: NASA-FAA-NOAA Partnering Strategy

publications.publicationName: Proceedings of the Second NASA Aviation Safety Program Weather Accident Prevention Review

related.title: Proceedings of the Second NASA Aviation Safety Program Weather Accident Prevention Review
